page.title: 10MARLAND CHURCH
page.content: The church was built in the mid 19th Century with seating capacity for 160. The two manual organ is played regularly, and the six bells which include the second oldest tenor in Devon and are rung on special occasions. The Patron (19th in succession) controls the Church and the services are taken by the Rector and Readers. The population of Marland is about 200 and the average congregation is approximately 15. A service is held every Sunday mornings. Special services include two harvests, one on weeknight followed by supper, confirmations, baptisms, weddings and funerals. Revels is celebrated by a Garden Fete. Future plans include an extension to the Church Yard and a Group Parochial Church Council.
